content.text:
Here is my response formatted as requested:

<OUTPUT_TEXT>

# Trial Preparation: Organizing Exhibits

1. Create an exhibit list
   - Make a master list of all potential exhibits
   - Assign unique numbers/letters to each exhibit
   - Include brief descriptions and relevance

2. Review and organize physical exhibits
   - Sort exhibits by type (documents, photos, objects, etc.)
   - Place in labeled folders or boxes
   - Create duplicate copies as needed

3. Prepare electronic exhibits
   - Scan paper documents
   - Save files with clear naming conventions
   - Create a digital exhibit folder structure

4. Mark exhibits
   - Apply exhibit stickers/labels to physical items
   - Add electronic exhibit stamps to digital files

5. Create exhibit binders
   - Organize exhibits in logical order
   - Include table of contents and tabs
   - Prepare copies for judge, opposing counsel, and witnesses

6. Develop exhibit presentation plan
   - Determine order of introduction
   - Prepare any necessary demonstrative aids
   - Test all electronic presentation equipment

7. Update exhibit list
   - Note any pre-trial rulings on admissibility
   - Make final revisions before trial

8. Coordinate with attorneys
   - Review exhibit strategy
   - Ensure all necessary exhibits are prepared
   - Discuss any last-minute additions or changes

</OUTPUT_TEXT>
